Orphapacket.Label: Bleeding diathesis due to thromboxane synthesis deficiency

ExternalReferences.DisorderMappingRelation: E (Exact mapping: the two concepts are equivalent)

TextSection.Contents: Bleeding diathesis due to thromboxane synthesis deficiency is a rare genetic isolated constitutional thrombocytopenia disease characterized by impaired platelet aggregation resulting from a defect in thromboxane synthesis or signaling manifesting with mild to moderate mucocutaneous gastrointestinal or surgical bleeding (e.g. easy bruising prolonged epistaxis excessive bleeding after a tooth extraction).
